title: Reunion
description: Experience your lost loves ones in a more resourceful way

steps.title: Intro
steps.description: In this process we'll explore different ways to increase the feelings of presence as you think of ${hchildName}, and the appreciation for having ${hchildHim} and this relationship in your life.

steps.title: Eliciting valued loss
steps.description: Think of ${hchildName} now, and make very sure that your representation is of what you valued and didn't want to lose, and not the loss/end of the relationship.
steps.notes:
For example, if ${hchildName} died of cancer, and you recall ${hchildHim} as emaciated and comatose shortly before death, that is probably not what you are sorry you no longer have.

What leads to grieving is what you valued and now miss - ${hchildName}’s laughter and play, special qualities, etc.

answers.text: OK, I’m thinking about what I valued

steps.title: Eliciting valued loss - description
steps.description: As you think of ${hchildName} in that way, notice what image comes to mind, and describe it to me a little bit.
steps.notes: Especially notice what you see, hear, and feel.

steps.title: Eliciting valued loss - validating
steps.description:
${echo}

Now just to be sure: that is what you valued in the relationship and didn’t want to lose, correct?

answers.text: Actually, let me make some modifications

steps.title: Eliciting valued loss - cue
steps.description:
${echo}

OK, we’ll call that the “cue”. Now you can put that cue experience aside for now, we’ll use it soon.

answers.text: OK, I’ve put the cue aside

steps.title: Eliciting resource - background
steps.description: Good, now, in all your years on this odd planet, you have met many people, some more meaningful to you than others, correct?

answers.text: Some more meaningful than others, correct

steps.title: Eliciting resource
steps.description:
${echo}

So I want you to think of someone who is no longer in your life, but as you think about him or her now, you feel their presence, and the warmth and appreciation for having them in your life, and getting to know them.
steps.notes:
Maybe it's a friend you used to have which makes you laugh, maybe it's a meaningful teacher or a family member. Maybe he/she is dead, maybe not, but that person is no longer in your life, and you have no access to them.

But as you think about him or her, you feel good.

Let me know when you got someone in mind.

steps.title: Eliciting resource - alternative
steps.description:
${echo}

So think of someone who you typically have available to you in your life but who is not physically present at this moment as you think about him/her now.

For example, you have a loving friend, a spouse, or another child who is actually distant at the moment.

Yet when you think about this person, you experience him/her with you as a present resource.
steps.notes:
**Note**: We are using this experience only to find out how you already know how to represent someone as present with you so that you can learn how to regain what you valued and the good feelings that you had with ${hchildName}.

You and I both know that you won't be able to contact ${hchildName} (at least in this physical dimension)

steps.title: Eliciting resource - alternative - validating
steps.description: Great, And as you think of this person now, they are not physically present in the room with you, they are meaningful to you, and you feel good to think about them now, correct?

answers.text: Actually, let me choose someone else

steps.title: Eliciting resource - validating
steps.description:
***"Got someone in mind"***

Great, and as you think of this person now, they are no longer in your life, they are meaningful to you, and you feel good to think about them now, correct?

answers.text: Actually, let me choose someone else

steps.title: Eliciting resource - name
steps.description:
***"correct"***

Good, and what is their name?
steps.notes: Nickname for reference will do as well

steps.title: Eliciting resource - description
steps.description:
Great, so keep thinking about ${s10}, and notice how do you experience and represent them in your mind.

Not a specific memory or experience, just how you see them as a person.
steps.notes:
You might see them looking at you, just as if they are right there in the room with you, next to you, or in front of you.

Maybe they are talking to you, or touching you in a certain way.

Take a moment to see, hear, and feel how you experience ${s10} now, and attend to the presence and appreciation feelings towards them.

Describe to me what comes to mind.

steps.title: Eliciting resource - description - validating
steps.description:
${echo}

And as you experience ${s10} this way, you can feel their presence, warmth and appreciation for getting to know them, correct?

answers.text: Yes, I feel good thinking about ${s10} now
Actually, let me choose someone else
Let me make some modifications for this person

steps.title: Eliciting resource - description - validating
steps.description:
${echo}

OK, we’ll call this the “resource”. It’s going to come in handy real soon.

steps.title: Congruence check (CC)
steps.description:
So you have the resource experience:
“${s11}”

And the cue experience:
“${s2}”

Do you have any objections to experience ${hchildName}, in the same way you experience ${s10}?
steps.notes: I.e. Feel ${hchildHis} presence, warmth, and appreciation towards the good times you shared, in the same way?

answers.text: I would LOVE to experience ${hchildName} like that

steps.title: Congruence check (CC)
steps.description:
${echo}

Great, that's usually the case, let's continue then.

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA)
steps.notes:
As you go back and forth between the two a few times, notice the visual, auditory, and tactile differences between the way you experience them.

What are the main differences you see, hear, and feel between the two? Write down all differences you can already notice.

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis - location & distance - validating
steps.description: Now check, as you look at the resource image and the cue image, are the images in the same place in your physical space?
steps.notes: For example you might see one image further away to your left, while the the other will be closer and to your right.

answers.text: One image is closer than the other
One image is higher than the other
One image is more to my right and the other to my left
One image is more in front of me than the other
The images are in the exact same place

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis - location $ distance - Validation
steps.description:
***“The images are in the exact same place”***

While it does happen that the images are in the same place and distance to begin with, it is very rare, so I just want to be thorough here, with your permission.

I want you to look again at the **resource image** again:
*${s11}*

Then at the **cue image** again:
*${s2}*

And go back and forth between the two a few times. Then close your eyes and point at the location you see each of them.

Are you pointing to the **exact same place**, and the images are the **exact same distance** from you?

answers.text: I’m pointing to the exact same place
I’m pointing to two different places

steps.title: Mapping Across - location & distance
steps.description:
Now notice what happens as you allow the cue image, to slide to the same location of the resource image.

So you see both images in the same location and distance from you.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - brightness / dimness

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - depth(3d)

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - vividness & focus

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - sound
steps.description:
Do any of the images have sound?

Voice, background noises, music, or any type of sound.

steps.title: Mapping Across - sound
steps.description:
***“Both have sound”***

Notice what happens as you allow the sound of the cue image, to become like the sound of the resource image.

So you hear both of them in the same way. Same sound quality, tempo, tone, volume, direction, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - sound
steps.description:
***“Cue does, resource doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you allow the cue image to become muted as well.

Like in a tv remote, as you press the “mute” button, or the “decrease volume” all the way to zero.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - sound
steps.description:
***“Resource does, cue doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you turn on the sound in the cue image, and allow it to become like the sound of the resource image.

Like in a tv remote, as you press the “mute/unmute” button, or the “increase volume” all the way to zero. So you hear both of them in the same way. Same sound quality, tempo, tone, direction, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - tactile / touch
steps.description:
Do any of the images have tactile sensations or a sense of touch?

I.e. you feel someone’s touch, something touching your skin, etc

steps.title: Mapping Across - tactile / touch
steps.description:
***“Both have tactile”***

Notice what happens as you allow the tactile sensations of the cue image, to become like the tactile sensations of the resource image.

So you feel the touch in both of them in the same way. Same texture, temperature, softness/stiffness, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - tactile / touch
steps.description:
***“Cue does, resource doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you allow the tactile sensation of the cue image to drain away, and become touchless/tactiless as well.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - tactile / touch
steps.description:
***“Resource does, cue doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you start feeling the sense of touch in the cue image, and allow it to become like the sense of touch in the resource image.

So you feel the touch in both of them in the same way. Same texture, temperature, softness/stiffness, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - remaining differences
steps.description:
Now go back and forth between both images and scan for remaining differences.

Is there anything else in the way you experience ${s10}, which you'd like to apply to ${hchildName}?

If so, allow these changes to take place now.

answers.text: I've found some differences and applied them
I don't find any other differences

steps.title: Intensifying ${hchildName}'s presence
steps.description:
${echo}

Now as you experience ${hchildName} in this way, make sure you see ${hchildHim} completely, ${hchildHis} whole body, in life size

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying ${hchildName}'s presence
steps.description:
${echo}

Now notice what happens as you allow ${hchildHis} image to become more focused, vivid, rich and colorful.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying ${hchildName}'s presence
steps.description:
${echo}

Next add depth so you see ${hchildHim} more in 3d, and make it sharper, brighter and more crisp.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying ${hchildName}'s presence
steps.description:
${echo}

Next notice if you see and hear ${hchildHim} talking to you, if it further increases and solidifies the feeling of presence.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying ${hchildName}'s presence
steps.description:
${echo}

And as you hear ${hchildHis} voice now, allow it to become richer, so you hear it in a fuller tone, coming from all around you in surround.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying ${hchildName}'s presence

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying ${hchildName}'s presence
steps.description:
${echo}

Notice if you already smell ${hchildHim} as well, or add a scent to the experience, how much it further increases the good feeling.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Intensifying ${hchildName}'s presence

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Congruence check (CC)
steps.description: As you experience ${hchildName} like that now, do you have any objections being this way, experiencing ${hchildHim} this way?
